Use natural remedies: If all medicines disappeared, people would have to rely on natural remedies to treat a common cold. This could include things like honey, ginger, garlic, and lemon. These natural remedies have been shown to have anti-inflammatory and antiviral properties that can help alleviate symptoms of a cold.

Use home remedies: People would also have to rely on home remedies to treat a common cold. This could include things like steam inhalation, salt water gargles, and nasal sprays made with ingredients like eucalyptus or peppermint. These remedies can help alleviate symptoms like congestion, sore throat, and cough.

Practice good hygiene: One of the best ways to prevent a cold is to practice good hygiene. This includes washing your hands regularly, covering your mouth and nose when you cough or sneeze, and avoiding close contact with people who are sick. By practicing good hygiene, you can reduce your risk of getting a cold.

Get plenty of rest: Another important thing to do when you have a cold is to get plenty of rest. This can help your body fight off the virus and recover more quickly. It's also important to stay hydrated by drinking plenty of fluids like water, juice, or tea.

Use essential oils: Essential oils like lavender, tea tree, and peppermint can be used to alleviate symptoms of a cold. These oils have anti-inflammatory and antiviral properties that can help reduce congestion, soothe a sore throat, and relieve a cough. You can use these oils by diffusing them into the air, applying them topically, or adding a few drops to a warm bath.
